For Problems 1920,
Use a calculator to graph the function for 0 \le x \le 2\pi.
Use the intersect feature to find all solutions between 0 and 2\pi. Round your answers to hundredths.
For Problems 2122, write a formula for the function.

statement.p: The average high temperature in Phoenix, Arizona is minimum in January at 66\degree and maximum in July at 105\degree. Write a sinusoidal function that models the average high temperature in Phoenix.
The average monthly rainfall in Hawaii reaches a maximum of 3.4 inches in December and a minimum of 0.4 inches in June. Write a sinusoidal function that models the monthly rainfall in Hawaii.

ol.label: a
ol.li: Estimate the amplitude, period, and midline of a circular function that fits the data.
Write a formula for the function.

introduction.p: For Problems 2528, give exact values for the solutions between 0 and 2\pi.
For Problems 2932, find all solutions between 0 and 2\pi. Round your answers to three decimal places.
For Problems 3336, use a substitution to find exact values for all solutions between 0 and 2\pi.
For Problems 3740, use a substitution to find all solutions between 0 and 2\pi. Round your answers to hundredths.
